summary: This is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing a draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondents debate the level of detail to include, balancing the need to instill public confidence and provide material for a press conference against protecting victims and preserving investigative advantages.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.role: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel (likely U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman)
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who would need material to work with at a press conference regarding the Epstein indictment.

events.title: Draft Indictment Prepared
events.description: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein is prepared and circulated for review within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was under review by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in June 2019.
Prosecutors debated the level of factual detail to include, with concerns about protecting victims and preserving confidential details to vet future witnesses.
A countervailing concern was the need to 'instill public confidence in the significance and seriousness of this case in light of the prior history'.
The correspondence indicates planning for a press conference, with the need to give 'Geoff' (likely U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman) sufficient material to present.
The email chain shows internal strategy discussions about managing public perception and victim protection in a high-profile case.
